document.title: Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Standards

B77B3DEB99D74C4A8E23416B70DB375B.description:
Devise and improve plans to
establish favorable environmental conditions
for animal growth and performance based
on a variety of factors (e.g., economic feasibility,
environmental sustainability, impact on
animals, etc.).

C62BCC8BEB48428190B63FB1D3D61D3B.description:
Implement and evaluate the
effectiveness of methods to ensure optimal
environmental conditions for animals.

8B2EF9D1CE0242FF93210636D654E9D6.description:
Identify and summarize
methods for ensuring optimal environmental
conditions for animals.

2EF485B93EB7416B8FCDC0CAA6414466.description:
Apply valid and reliable
research evidence to predict the potential
effects of different environmental conditions
for an animal population.

69BBD345A07E45D5B903933BCBC60DF0.description:
Critique the reliability and
validity of evidence presented to support
claims regarding the effects of environmental
conditions on animal populations and performance
(e.g., population changes, emerging
species, extinction, etc.).

7356C4AD668D42EE8A8067F3C86CAE8B.description:
Research and summarize
environmental conditions that impact animals
(e.g., weather, sources of water, food resources,
etc.).

309873F6A0CC40CB9A3A385F63CAC2C5.description:
Evaluate the effects of environmental conditions on animals and create plans to
ensure favorable environments for animals.

91E8CFEF69174BE99EC68073C1FCFB61.description:
Devise a plan that includes
measures to reduce the impact of animal
agriculture on the environment

25D91F3BE8DB414D95B3AF2725DF767C.description:
Assess the effectiveness of
methods of reducing the effects of animal
agriculture on the environment.

D212DCB5FD824369B2FEA89F27B1E05D.description:
Identify and summarize the
effects of animal agriculture on the environment
(e.g., waste disposal, carbon footprint,
air quality, environmental efficiencies, etc.).

8F756007637342D598264E095FB99CF7.description:
Design and implement methods to reduce the effects of animal production on the
environment.

9621AC18DF334DC38975EFE8ABD08CFF.description: Analyze environmental factors associated with animal production.

0388722D25364C979FB843CAEDF39F3E.description:
Research and evaluate the
effectiveness of zoonotic disease prevention
methods and procedures to identify those
that are best suited to ensure public safety
and animal welfare.

0AD7BB8E37B3449BB9AFA9C13D5D7033.description:
Analyze the health risk of
different zoonotic diseases to humans and
identify prevention methods.

C3E2EF79701945B6A19CF830FCD753F3.description:
Identify and describe zoonotic
diseases including their historical significance
and potential future implications

E60BE504961046DA8E814D7FE9D35496.description:
Design and evaluate a biosecurity
plan for an animal production operation.

4D22FEC763A5403A875C57429D1C178C.description:
Analyze procedures at the
local, state and national levels to ensure biosecurity
of the animal industry.

BFE74C75FECE4D74970AD454C04C40E1.description:
Summarize the importance of
biosecurity to the animal industry at multiple
levels (e.g., local, state, national, global).

496C8DEDB67B42A18970DBCCE8F18B34.description:
Analyze biosecurity measures utilized to protect the welfare of animals on a local,
state, national, and global level.

71C31E0728B64AA891674A6ABE6EFB1C.description:
Identify and describe surgical
and nonsurgical veterinary treatments and
procedures to meet specific animal health
care objectives.

4968E1A478C5458788476D226989065A.description:
Assess the safety and effectiveness
of facilities and equipment used for
surgical and nonsurgical veterinary treatments
and procedures.

C7A411EED14943218A9CE70E93BBDF3D.description:
Explain the clinical significance
of common veterinary methods and treatment
(e.g., aseptic techniques, antibiotic use,
wound management, etc.).

64EDDB56AF5A48AFAF9D4B400F1868E1.description:
Design and implement a
health maintenance and a disease and disorder
prevention plan for animals in their
natural and/or confined environments.

74783B4579F24C8B85838CE64C5048A1.description:
Research and analyze data to
evaluate preventive measures for controlling
and limiting the spread of diseases, parasites
and disorders among animals.

4F53500CEAF04DC8999BC1324553BD8C.description:
Identify and summarize characteristics
of causal agents and vectors of
diseases and disorders in animals.

16D6E5FD7FED473297D03D2F1046EA2C.description:
Treat common diseases, parasites
and physiological disorders of animals
according to directions prescribed by an
animal health professional.

431EFFB95F474D448968208C5776C7F2.description:
Identify and describe common
illnesses and disorders of animals based on
symptoms and problems caused by wounds,
diseases, parasites and physiological disorders

B3D1094FC8484D8DA5B8313E3333C0A6.description:
List and summarize the characteristics
of wounds, common diseases,
parasites and physiological disorders that
affect animals.

B4BB3A1F84F349FCB37D18010248F674.description:
Determine when an animal
health concern needs to be referred to an
animal health professional.

779E2303C6854421ABADD564F325DC5C.description:
Perform simple health-check
evaluations on animals and practice basic
emergency response procedures related to
animals.

16F7D8D13BAF47EE8F9EBB69C55A0944.description:
Explain methods of determining
animal health and disorders.

3A7306DA48EC4D7FB0385459092DBC0B.description:
Select and use tools and technology
to meet specific animal health management
goals.

55BC5767B88D4BDDBA3C16E04B604F2B.description:
Describe and demonstrate the
proper use and function of specific tools and
technology related to animal health management.

5435ADFE30D44CFBABD908BA4F8470BB.description:
Identify and summarize specific
tools and technology used in animal health
management.

778331FE2A1C41E19FA9234B051D2002.description:
Design programs to prevent animal diseases, parasites and other disorders and
ensure animal welfare.

17BC7B7B177E45B5B024D64DD9C765A0.description: Apply principles of effective animal health care.

A92E1A695EDF4FB991DB4EEA9C9B5FB7.description:
Evaluate and select animals to
produce superior animal products based on
industry standards.

5658BB354A2E4B77BFADC170734DD8F0.description:
Evaluate and select products
from animals based on industry standards.

457C618BCFF74DED9BC96E773845679D.description:
Research and summarize the
use of products and by-products derived
from animals.

E25EF4286C07408F88AA524AEBB0570C.description:
Choose, implement and evaluate
sustainable and efficient procedures (e.g.,
selection, housing, nutrition and management)
to produce consistently high-quality
animals that are well suited for their intended
purposes.

DBF25591E127459884160A8B0260C908.description:
Compare and contrast procedures
to sustainably and efficiently develop
an animal to reach its highest performance
potential with respect to its anatomical and
physiological characteristics.

ADD846F7913F466BB8E50AA6CA498B5A.description:
Evaluate an animal against its
optimal anatomical and physiological characteristics.

44EFA56F41BA476BB8338F2004B45774.description:
Evaluate and select animals to
maximize performance based on anatomical
and physiological characteristics that affect
health, growth and reproduction.

CC7DC7B0732343099FD60C8F12DC39E3.description:
Compare and contrast desirable
anatomical and physiological characteristics
of animals within and between species.

51CA08A44A7049209D55FE85C30E6229.description:
Identify and summarize how
an animal’s health can be affected by anatomical
and physiological disorders.

3D5CA688D0764F03B5B8860BDE56BABE.description:
Select and train animals for specific purposes and maximum performance based on
anatomy and physiology.

4059EE6975DF47B296D73204598B0B3B.description:
Apply knowledge of anatomical
and physiological characteristics of animals
to make production and management
decisions.

AC83B0B9F3C149B2A20656BD03356CD1.description:
Compare and contrast animal
cells, tissues, organs, body systems types and
functions among animal species.

02CC6231A4074B53B43ABF749D1E6DC9.description:
Identify and summarize the
properties, locations, functions and types of
animal cells, tissues, organs and body systems.

660264FA5A8A4996A95BC845FC17536F.description:
Apply the processes of meiosis
and mitosis to solve animal growth, development,
health and reproductive problems.

9C89E709393F4C49AE4DEC1B37ECF3A4.description:
Analyze the processes of
meiosis and mitosis in animal growth, development,
health and reproduction.

7A177C27CB9D44AF982EC9A5EC242E77.description:
Examine the basic functions
of animal cells in animal growth and reproduction.

56EFF8554CDA4D86A5628F701ED8DF3D.description:
Correlate the functions of animal
cell structures to animal growth, development,
health and reproduction.

222A9E7DEF2B44808B189A3B13FFA619.description:
Analyze the functions of each
animal cell structure.

70D021009D554D518886C9359C70F0E4.description:
Research and summarize characteristics
of a typical animal cell and identify
the organelles.

4413BDCDF1D84E0E9D4C300E44927DC4.description:
Apply principles of comparative anatomy and physiology to uses within various
animal systems.

534A906EDA5A4CD48433F55BF2F99D08.description:
Apply knowledge of classification
terms to communicate with others about
animal systems in an effective and accurate
manner.

F80B90D2476F47BAB41EE8A360F9E20D.description:
Analyze the visual characteristics
of an animal or animal product and select
correct classification terminology when referring
to companion and production animals.

877EC5AB6CAB4EE2B2AD1C830F4DF6CE.description:
Identify and summarize common
classification terms utilized in animal
systems (e.g., external and internal body
parts, maturity, mature male, immature female,
animal products, breeds, etc.).

28CA78CEADC54AE9B24F73135F0068C1.description:
Recommend different uses for
an animal species based upon an analysis of
local market needs.

2D0E44C6A3084E8AA7E07444CE2703AB.description:
Appraise and evaluate the
economic value of animals for various applications
in the agriculture industry.

01781852A0AE4A72B777F90572F47EDB.description:
Compare and contrast major
uses of different animal species (e.g., agricultural,
companion, etc.).

09AEF72EEB154C9887BA59242D57C5FE.description:
Assess taxonomic characteristics
and classify animals according to the
taxonomic classification system.

33D40506E5F8441E960A5B6EDA29BF7E.description:
Explain how animals are classified
using a taxonomic classification system.

A551195A833642B28058AB8B7E6ED440.description:
Explain the importance of the
binomial nomenclature system for classifying
animals

78C744486EC04456AF192C54B09255C4.description:
Classify animals according to taxonomic classification systems and use (e.g.
agricultural, companion, etc.).

F924D497C1054F82BA18DAF4E2CD2C29.description:
Classify, evaluate and select animals based on anatomical and
physiological characteristics.

B0D53B9CE3CA4EE0B02B0BF5DBDD3032.description:
Evaluate the impact of laws
pertaining to animal systems.

F9AB6058446047B889B7D320DF717C4E.description:
Analyze the structure of laws
pertaining to animal systems.

B16CF3270AF7443897508FE1DF5802F8.description:
Distinguish between the types
of laws and regulations pertaining to animal
systems.

76A3DBB7A23744D680DE5EF32F06B1D9.description:
Evaluate facility designs and
make recommendations to ensure that it
meets standards for the legal, safe, ethical,
economical and efficient production of animals.

00C33A3602F74AE984F455F2479F58BE.description:
Analyze animal facilities to
determine if standards have been met.

F44FCC92360F40699776A057EBCB571C.description:
Identify and summarize the
general standards that must be met in facilities
for animal production (e.g., environmental,
zoning, construction, etc.).

C6B233F86EC64FBCB42EBA02C61E5630.description:
Comply with government regulations and safety standards for facilities used in
animal production.

72885593327645F1A161F5AB20396759.description:
Select, use and evaluate
equipment, technology and handling procedures
to enhance sustainability and production
efficiency.

5B6FF539D7804A47B26E57BAED6C511B.description:
Analyze the use of modern
equipment, technology and handling facility
procedures and determine if they enhance
the safe, economic and sustainable production
of animals.

4E16164F583F4BB2B00336CEC9F93946.description:
Identify and summarize equipment,
technology and handling facility procedures
used in modern animal production (e.g.,
climate control devices, sensors, automation,
etc.).

544D829007B34D3DB752671D4F81F138.description:
Design an animal facility
focusing on animal requirements, economic
efficiency, sustainability, safety and ease of
handling.

FF355CE850264B7F8AB264C0FF3FF585.description:
Critique designs for an animal
facility and prescribe alternative layouts and
adjustments for the safe, sustainable and efficient
use of the facility.

C09739D5F704454FA7D8139B53415618.description:
Differentiate between the
types of facilities needed to house and produce
animal species safely and efficiently.

62E7B7BA9D204C999B61BDB7BA27E1BC.description:
Design animal housing, equipment and handling facilities for the major systems of
animal production.

3C921917F9964622B0D6507F93E5E1CC.description:
Evaluate environmental factors affecting animal performance and
implement procedures for enhancing performance and animal health.

6DAD2016C0DA42868F15081EF3493F6C.description:
Select and assess animal
performance based on quantitative breeding
values for specific characteristics.

8BB9B4C416974B8E86B4FCFB057A8F8C.description:
Compare and contrast quantitative
breeding value differences between
genetically superior animals and animals of
average genetic value.

20CECF50C9944AC5BC819D3BCDB91780.description:
Examine the use of quantitative
breeding values (e.g., EPDs, Performance
records, pedigrees) in the selection of genetically
superior breeding stock.

DF8876016D18465D9FCFB6AF344A867A.description:
Create and evaluate plans
and procedures for estrous synchronization,
superovulation, flushing, embryo transfer and
other reproductive management practices.

46A5E59D6F3D4CAD9FF7DCF3A3F21736.description:
Analyze the processes of
major reproductive management practices,
including estrous synchronization, superovulation,
flushing and embryo transfer.

5A558E672A544D07881CF186FFBE5E0E.description:
Identify and summarize the
advantages and disadvantages of major
reproductive management practices, including
estrous synchronization, superovulation,
flushing and embryo transfer (e.g., cost, labor,
equipment, etc.).

ADE9800416AD44BCAE111F842F46DFAB.description:
Evaluate the implementation
and effectiveness of artificial insemination
techniques.

7CECAF40F7164A58A12E1618408FD6D8.description:
Analyze the materials, methods
and processes of artificial insemination.

F721A0A135824731B4A97A692CB9F47A.description:
Select animal breeding methods
based on reproductive and economic
efficiency

2CC273A69171464CA0742CDAB651B62C.description:
Calculate the potential economic
benefits of natural versus artificial
breeding methods.

E9A80249C9E94894B89273C6D36E46A8.description:
Identify and categorize natural
and artificial breeding methods (e.g., natural
breeding, artificial insemination, estrous synchronization,
flushing, cloning, etc.).

1C5701D2F10A401B84C581800E9D41E6.description: Apply scientific principles to breed animals.

07C62BEC0D5E472183435C0E458E8771.description:
Create a plan to differentiate
care of a species of breeding animals
throughout their growth stages.

A97FA2DC6F5144E9ACE1D55AF1925B54.description:
Analyze the care needs for
breeding stock in each stage of growth.

31024405318848F88DFC80072EAFFBD1.description:
Identify and summarize different
needs of breeding animals based on
their growth stages (e.g., newborn, parturition,
gestation, gestation lengths, etc.).

7793238F203443069DF355B53557196B.description:
Perform a DNA analysis and
use the data to make and defend breeding
decisions.

65CB766E132943819329FB33D140963C.description:
Analyze how DNA analysis
can detect genetic defects in breeding stock.

04AE0A5751FE48AABB31A1D05C8CED86.description:
Identify and summarize genetic
defects that affect animal performance.

1B99047853CF4FF4ABE7456E0A8BF603.description:
Select and evaluate breeding
animals and determine the probability of a
given trait in their offspring.

929637FA06844227A2E1D8E088873DB8.description:
Demonstrate how to determine
probability trait inheritance in animals.

A5D24A5E8122425AAA3AC6C04C957C95.description:
Identify and summarize inheritance
and terms related to inheritance in
animal breeding (e.g., dominate, co-dominate,
recessive, homozygous, heterozygous, etc.).

883454AB87954423B8D75DBB34EE53F4.description:
Select and evaluate a breeding
system based on the principles of genetics.

B1AD33FEB5FA4CDF828E150AC4605D0C.description:
Compare and contrast the use
of genetically superior animals in the production
of animals and animal products.

D01F0369E83445FE98E248F7BBB1827F.description: Apply scientific principles to select and care for breeding animals.

6C514638CA73462785C0F508AD1F760B.description:
Treat or cull animals with
reproductive problems.

693D45454A114654A1F85866F7713292.description:
Evaluate reproductive problems
that occur in animals.

D0F80685EFCB42C8ADF17149D73137FA.description:
Summarize the importance
of efficient and economic reproduction in
animals.

B2EBFFB9EA2E4B0F8029D2BC32BBFBA0.description:
Evaluate and select animals
for reproductive readiness.

C28DD9A94F064F71813E2F17A21D6A4B.description:
Assess and describe factors
that lead to reproductive maturity.

718BD26D7E6B469D92AED79232C631D1.description:
Compare and contrast how
age, size, life cycle, maturity level and health
status affect the reproductive efficiency of
male and female animals.

58B7C93926C14F64BB28F58D3B7EBF50.description:
Select breeding animals based
on characteristics of the reproductive organs.

066E3A9A7A4D4E84BFAF5F4BF5CBF86B.description:
Analyze the functions of major
organs in the male and female reproductive
systems.

B62675197DED4715915494907F7C10DE.description:
Identify and categorize the
male and female reproductive organs of the
major animal species.

7CD035832475493D9C2788E1D5676661.description: Evaluate animals for breeding readiness and soundness.

CAA62E2E138744B4A83A90C9DF797742.description:
Apply principles of animal reproduction to achieve desired outcomes for
performance, development and/or economic production.

6C9C07C95AF249258780A27782FA09B2.description:
Research and recommend
technology improvements to provide proper
nutrition to animals.

96A890B01ADF48F3B05795B585625E79.description:
Analyze technologies used to
provide animal nutrition and summarize their
potential benefits and consequences.

E84A4F7D71884FAC9194A09115F254F9.description:
Examine the use of technology
to provide animal nutrition.

1622DDDE38824D66899988B17D884E3C.description:
Evaluate and summarize the
potential impacts, positive and negative, of
compliance and/or noncompliance with a
feed label and feeding directions.

95B9CF591F9342B4A61B8945DA65A69F.description:
Analyze and apply information
from a feed label and feeding directions
to feed animals.

A6FE27AF39E14A19B77239DD8943ED19.description:
Examine and summarize the
meaning of various components of feed labels
and feeding directions.

79A3052D050548F38DFE3190B527667F.description:
Select, evaluate and defend
the use of specific tools or equipment used to
perform animal nutrition tasks.

7F5B1D485A9C466AA8D65B22E7CB4F5C.description:
Utilize tools and equipment to
perform animal nutrition tasks.

2C684D40795C47129F6D3E1F0BA18212.description:
Identify and categorize tools
and equipment used to meet animal nutrition
needs and ensure an abundant and safe food
supply

ACCC2DCE8F5D4A0E9A6CFBEBA77C69E2.description: Utilize industry tools to make animal nutrition decisions.

BBC3EA78B6E5406FB8448C58B22C38AC.description:
Make and defend decisions
regarding whether to use feed additives and
growth promotants after researching and
considering scientific evidence, production
system needs and goals, and input from industry
professionals.

CCE376BDF5A84D8D9D863A5DB66F1593.description:
Compare and contrast methods
that utilize feed additives and growth
promotants with production practices that do
not, (e.g., organic versus conventional production
methods).

E99CB14F86534B3BB45E36F5AF5BBAE2.description:
Examine the purpose, impact
and mode of action of feed additives and
growth promotants in animal production.

F33422B215784E27814A32B976B34073.description:
Select and utilize animal feeds
based on nutritional requirements, using
rations for maximum nutrition and optimal
economic production.

0D7DA1777FB5456CB4488A6122B632ED.description:
Appraise the adequacy of
feed rations using data from the analysis of
feedstuffs, animal requirements and performance.

4B9A26CBACCF41E28E413AE8D210479E.description:
Examine the importance of
a balanced ration for animals based on the
animal’s growth stage (e.g., maintenance,
newborn, gestation, lactation, etc.).

27FC204412FE4C7F9DB17FF19AD531F4.description:
Select appropriate feedstuffs
for animals based on a variety of factors (e.g.,
economics, digestive system and nutritional
needs, etc.).

43FF899767BD4E4F819CE2A5E6E1700F.description:
Determine the relative nutritional
value of feedstuffs by evaluating their
general quality and condition.

AFB6BE65B7EE4DD6AFE2FAAD6122A807.description:
Compare and contrast common
types of feedstuffs and the roles they
play in the diets of animals.

164A40167FBF43B1BE93B7A8A7A5D69D.description: Analyze feed rations and assess if they meet the nutritional needs of animals.

0CFF9EBEF47B49A4A350E0EC3A52D3BB.description:
Design and defend the use of
a nutritional program by demonstrating the
relationship between the nutrient requirements
and the feedstuffs provided.

9497BFE275F24F17B7A37CFBCCD33C33.description:
Correlate a species’ nutritional
needs to feedstuffs that could meet those
needs.

B3337E677B9E41DAACD13BC1315FC2B5.description:
Differentiate between nutritional
needs of animal species.

A252737362D34D75914ED238C6116D05.description:
Assess nutritional needs for an
individual animal based on its growth stage
and production system.

57BFF3B6D88E45558C780959D3F01457.description:
Differentiate between nutritional
needs of animals in different growth
stages and production systems (e.g., maintenance,
gestation, natural, organic, etc.).

5A4608BC6E204E7A9C0EF518A2610A5C.description:
Identify and summarize essential
nutrients required for animal health and
analyze each nutrient’s role in growth and
performance.

BE257EB33B994DF9BF59B662BDBD1608.description: Analyze the nutritional needs of animals.

40FFD41E9DFE482D8D48A3D98A815CEA.description:
Design and provide proper animal nutrition to achieve desired outcomes
for performance, development, reproduction and/or economic production.

B4FE156B80EB4742916B49B45607BDC7.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of
animal and/or premise identification programs
for a given species.

0ACC22B2079E481DBBD55E5C5C138E75.description:
Analyze and summarize the
impact of animal trace-back capabilities on
producers and consumers.

57C5D75BA4BA4901BEC404816C6D95E2.description:
Identify and describe animal
tracking systems used in animal systems (e.g.,
livestock, companion animal, exotics, etc.).

CABAF3641C8E4FEDBC779872DE3276C8.description:
Research and evaluate programs
to assure the safety of animal products
for consumption.

088943AD6D584D21A5221C8AB96542BF.description:
Analyze consumer concerns
with animal production practices relative to
human health.

C8F7C2BDBD8B4BAEBE757952514D113D.description:
Research and summarize
animal production practices that may pose
health risks.

A7A686992C6149678450120B2BFD6644.description:
Select, evaluate and defend
the use of specific tools, technology or equipment
used to perform animal husbandry and
welfare tasks.

D3D41B82502A44A4A7E8522143555D41.description:
Utilize tools, technology and
equipment to perform animal husbandry and
welfare tasks.

8B55F035FF7B43BC87FAC89655848215.description:
Identify and categorize tools,
technology and equipment used in animal
husbandry and welfare to help provide an
abundant and safe food supply.

3EC5811D22FA41B6BE1C7271603EDDA6.description:
Analyze procedures to ensure that animal products are safe for consumption (e.g.,
use in food system, etc.).

B3AB9A08E53143929863E7020F446B8F.description:
Devise economical recommendations
to increase the welfare of animals in
animal systems.

6CFA1C0F087B4C91B2E49E1119190C96.description:
Analyze and document animal
husbandry practices and their impact on
animal welfare.

478DD0B00A284DA8BD2590B073586009.description:
Distinguish between animal
husbandry practices that promote animal
welfare and those that do not.

415881A4524E407C8989299E43231BBB.description:
Devise, implement and evaluate
safety procedures and plans for working
with animals by species using information
based on animal behavior and responses.

B5EA9DFEA006475F8FDDB61FAEA5BAB6.description:
Analyze and document animal
welfare procedures used to ensure safety and
maintain low stress when moving and restraining
animals.

E4C5548E6C794944BB6728602A18FF21.description:
Research and summarize the
challenges involved in working with animals
and resources available to overcome them
(e.g., tools, technology, equipment, facilities,
animal behavior signals, etc.).

D9FC6F36602C40EAAC1C58EF1B37B73F.description:
Implement and evaluate quality-assurance
programs and procedures for
animal production.

9322BAD616D84B60906FC5614B6C5DBA.description:
Design programs that assure
the welfare of animals and prevent abuse or
mistreatment.
